User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

Selecting Firefox Button > Print brings up a small printer dialog box window. Selecting Alt > F > Page Setup also brings up a small dialog box window. Selecting Alt > F > Print Preview brings up a maximized window with a print preview of the page.

It would be more efficient, user friendly, and save users time from having to navigate window to window in order to page setup, print preview, and then print if the "Print Preview" and "Page Setup" selections were eliminated and instead all integrated into a maximized dialog/settings window with a print preview. So there would never be anymore need to select Print Preview or Page Setup. Selecting Firefox Button > Print would open a maximized window with print/page related settings/options on the left margin and the whole rest of the window would generate a print preview for what is about to be printed. If a setting is changed (e.g., Landscape/Portrait) the Print Preview would adjust to reflect the change. It would always provide users with a print preview before printing, allowing users to immediately spot problems with the print job and avoid wasting ink/paper on what would otherwise be a botched print job. Presently, it is an enormous amount of work to go to Page Setup and Print Preview and then Print. It could instead all be accomplished by going to one place: Firefox Button > Print

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Firefox Button > Print
2. 
3.

Actual Results:  
a small printer settings window opens

Expected Results:  
a maximized window should open, displaying printer settings and page settings along the left margin and using the rest of the space to display a "Live" print preview

This would also simplify the Firefox Button because you could eliminate the "Print Preview" and "Page Setup" sub-menus.
